precontext: Mark reached into his backpack and felt around. He found the small object he'd been searching for. A smile spread across his face as he imagined its potential.
sentence: Mark believed he could draw it very quickly.
meanings_considered: bring, take, or pull out of a container or from under a cover
represent by making a drawing of, as with a pencil, chalk, etc. on a surface
explanation:
• The precontext describes Mark reaching into his backpack and finding an object, suggesting a physical action of retrieving something from a container.  
• "Draw" in the sentence "Mark believed he could draw it very quickly" logically follows the first meaning (to pull out or take from a container), as he is trying to retrieve the object.  
• The second meaning (to make a drawing) is not supported by the context, as there is no mention of drawing, art, or visual representation, and the object is already found.
clear_meaning_text: bring, take, or pull out of a container or from under a cover
